intro: Passerina tarton-raira f. valentina, commonly known as the Valentina's spurge. This plant is a member of the Euphorbiaceae family and is characterized by its succulent, fleshy stems and leaves. It produces small, clustered flowers that are typically greenish-yellow in color. The plant is native to specific regions in South America and thrives in arid or semi-arid environments. It is often cultivated for its ornamental value due to its unique appearance and resilience.
